title: Do evil people deserve to be reincarnated? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are no evil people. There are people who do evil actions. The point of reincarnation is spiritual growth, within a life, and life after life. We are all apprentice Buddhas, apprentice Jesuses. A person who automatically, intuitively reacts with unconditional love to all living beings has qualified and can get off the wheel of life. Note this does not imply acceptance of evil, but rather than judging or punishing, the enlightened person’s automatic reaction is, “How can I lead this misguided child to growth?” The process of growth needs to start somewhere. The first lesson is empathy. I care for you in your suffering. I rejoice with you when you are happy. Infant souls lack empathy. For them, others are either tools to be used or obstacles to be removed. Evil actions are possible if you lack empathy. In every generation, there are mature souls who are enlightened, or close to it. And you don’t need to live perfect, only die perfect to qualify. And, because of the population explosion of the past few hundred years, there are very many more young souls. They do the wrong things because, as yet, they know no better.

Do evil people deserve to be reincarnated? During the 1980s I ran in an 11 km fun run called Sutherland to Surf. When I finished I did a U-turn and started running back the other way, so that I could find my son and run in with him. As I made my way back, a spectator who knew me personally, yelled out, “And you’ll keep doing it till you get it right!” Personally, I don’t believe in reincarnation, but I know that many people do. So I’m going to look at it from the point of view of that spectator. If somebody stuffs up their life by being evil, wouldn’t it be good if they could keep doing it until they get it right? It certainly seems more humane than condemning them to eternal torment.

you make it sound like a reward. the point is that existence is suffering, living is hell. someone in the habit of doing evil acts is probably going to have to keep doing evil eternally. that’s a punishment. the bible says that the reward of sin is death. that’s what seems unjust to me. in jehovah’s world we get off easy

What makes you think they would WANT to be? If there is the slightest justice in the reincarnation system, they will carry the load of their cruelties & crimes on their backs in their next life. Maybe be born crippled, or as sex slaves, or as minorities under Hitler or Stalin, or under similar terrible circumstances. My advice to the evil of this world is to stay away from this planet at all costs - and reincarnate elsewhere!

After their purging in hell they will have to figure out what they should do to escape it. Their reincarnation doesn't mean that they won't bear the scars of their fallen countenance. Yet, despite Satan's familiarity with their previous vices and other weaknesses, their duty remains the same as all: Honor and appreciate your instinct (aka, your soul), express it and protect it from corruption. That is how all of us are created equal.
It is not necessarily a reward, being reborn as a slug or a bobbitt worm(Google it) is hardly to be envied.
